title: Error when retrieving noise type that sensor doesn't have specified

content.raw:
If I have an imu sensor with no noise specified in the SDF, when I go to call e.g. `sensor->Noise(gazebo::sensors::SensorNoiseType::IMU_LINACC_X_NOISE_METERS_PER_S_SQR)`, I'm seeing "Get noise index not valid" errors printed from here: #!/osrf/gazebo/src/f4e51e8f64001beda70615ab8982a7d5a4e65b18/gazebo/sensors/Sensor.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Sensor.cc-454.

(context: https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/793/files#r211036103)


Which of the following would be most appropriate?

1. remove that error message (most straightforward, but it's up to the caller to know that their request is a valid one).
1. always set the relevant noise models [when initialising the sensor](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f4e51e8f64001beda70615ab8982a7d5a4e65b18/gazebo/sensors/ImuSensor.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ImuSensor.cc-156), defaulting to no noise.
1. add a method to check if the sensor has that noise model, which should be called before  calling `sensor->Noise()`

If I have an imu sensor with no noise specified in the SDF, when I go to call e.g. sensor->Noise(gazebo::sensors::SensorNoiseType::IMU_LINACC_X_NOISE_METERS_PER_S_SQR), I'm seeing "Get noise index not valid" errors printed from here: #!/osrf/gazebo/src/f4e51e8f64001beda70615ab8982a7d5a4e65b18/gazebo/sensors/Sensor.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Sensor.cc-454.

(context: https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/793/files#r211036103)

Which of the following would be most appropriate?

  1. remove that error message (most straightforward, but it's up to the caller to know that their request is a valid one).
  2. always set the relevant noise models when initialising the sensor, defaulting to no noise.
  3. add a method to check if the sensor has that noise model, which should be called before calling sensor->Noise()
